intro: Euphrasia minima var. genargentea, commonly known as the silver-haired eyebright, is a small flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving the plant its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and traditional medicinal uses.
